info.title: PolicyClient
info.description: To manage and control access to your resources, you can define customized policies and assign them at a scope.

delete.description: This operation deletes the policy with the given ID. Policy assignment IDs have this format: '{scope}/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/policyAssignments/{policyAssignmentName}'. Valid formats for {scope} are: '/providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/{managementGroup}' (management group), '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}' (subscription), '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}' (resource group), or '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resourceProviderNamespace}/[{parentResourcePath}/]{resourceType}/{resourceName}' (resource).

properties.description: Allow only storage accounts of SKU Standard_GRS or Standard_LRS to be created

parameters.name: policyAssignmentId
parameters.description: The ID of the policy assignment to delete. Use the format '{scope}/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/policyAssignments/{policyAssignmentName}'.

200.description: OK - Returns information about the policy assignment.

204.description: No Content - the policy assignment doesn't exist.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

CloudError.description: An error response from a policy operation.

displayName.description: The display name of the policy assignment.

policyDefinitionId.description: The ID of the policy definition or policy set definition being assigned.

scope.description: The scope for the policy assignment.

parameters.description: The parameter values for the assigned policy rule. The keys are the parameter names.

description.description: This message will be part of response in case of policy violation.

metadata.description: The policy assignment metadata. Metadata is an open ended object and is typically a collection of key value pairs.

enforcementMode.description: The policy assignment enforcement mode. Possible values are Default and DoNotEnforce.

values.description: The policy effect is enforced during resource creation or update.
The policy effect is not enforced during resource creation or update.

ParameterValues.description: The parameter values for the policy rule. The keys are the parameter names.

name.description: The name of the policy sku. Possible values are A0 and A1.

tier.description: The policy sku tier. Possible values are Free and Standard.

PolicySku.description: The policy sku. This property is optional, obsolete, and will be ignored.

id.description: The ID of the policy assignment.

type.description: The type of the policy assignment.

name.description: The name of the policy assignment.

sku.description: The policy sku. This property is optional, obsolete, and will be ignored.

location.description: The location of the policy assignment. Only required when utilizing managed identity.

identity.description: The managed identity associated with the policy assignment.

nextLink.description: The URL to use for getting the next set of results.

principalId.description: The principal ID of the resource identity.

tenantId.description: The tenant ID of the resource identity.

type.description: The identity type. This is the only required field when adding a system assigned identity to a resource.

values.description: Indicates that a system assigned identity is associated with the resource.
Indicates that no identity is associated with the resource or that the existing identity should be removed.

ErrorAdditionalInfo.description: The resource management error additional info.

SubscriptionIdParameter.name: subscriptionId
SubscriptionIdParameter.description: The ID of the target subscription.

ApiVersionParameter.name: api-version
ApiVersionParameter.description: The API version to use for the operation.

ManagementGroupIdParameter.name: managementGroupId
ManagementGroupIdParameter.description: The ID of the management group.
